src:
Casado eleva el tono contra Sánchez y asegura que "le interesaba la violencia" en Cataluña
03 Nov 2019, 17:44 by Diariocrítico
El líder del PP, Pablo Casado se ha lanzado al ataque contra el presidente del Gobierno en funciones, Pedro Sánchez y ha vuelto a dejar de lado el discurso moderado para elevar el tono. El 'popular' ha acusado al socialista de haber hecho coincidir la convocatoria de elecciones con la sentencia del procés porque "pensaba que le interesaba que hubiera violencia esos días".
Casado ha cargado duramente contra Sánchez y ha llegado a hacerle responsable de los altercados que pudieran ocurrir en Cataluña por la visita del rey Felipe VI y la princesa Leonor el próximo sábado, un día antes de las elecciones del 10-N.
En un discurso alejado de la moderación, Casado ha acusado a Sánchez de haber "forzado la repetición de elecciones" teniendo en cuenta que la sentencia del Tribunal Supremo del juicio del procés iba a llegar el 14 de octubre.
"Lo sabía y ha hecho coincidir las elecciones porque pensaba que le interesaba que hubiera violencia esos días y él apareciera como el de la porra envuelto en la bandera, pero en cuanto las encuestas han empezado a estar en 120, no vamos a molestar al PSC y a los independentistas por si necesitáramos otra vez sus apoyos", ha denunciado el líder del PP.
En su ataque contra Sánchez, Casado le ha llegado a responsabilizar de los posibles altercados que pueda ocasionar la visita del Rey y la Princesa de Asturias a Girona el próximo sábado 9 de noviembre.
Por ello, ha instado al presidente del Gobierno en funciones a "poner orden en Cataluña de una vez, o la pondremos nosotros a partir del 10-N, porque es necesaria la libertad y la Constitución". Casado ha denunciado que Sánchez es "triplemente responsable y no puede mirar a otro lado, porque no ha querido hacer nada, porque no le ha dejado el PSC y se ha plegado a los nacionalistas: no hay elecciones que merezcan este escarnio".
text:
Casado raises his tone against Sánchez and says he "was interested in violence" in Catalonia
03 Nov 2019, 17:44 by Diariocritical
The leader of the PP, Pablo Casado has launched into the attack against the president of the acting Government, Pedro Sánchez and has again set aside the moderate speech to raise the tone. The 'popular' has accused the socialist of having matched the call for elections with the sentence of the process because "he thought he was interested in violence during those days."
Casado has charged heavily against Sánchez and has come to hold him responsible for the altercations that could occur in Catalonia by the visit of King Felipe VI and Princess Leonor next Saturday, a day before the 10-N elections.
In a speech far from moderation, Casado has accused Sánchez of having "forced the repetition of elections" taking into account that the ruling of the Supreme Court of the trial of the process was going to arrive on October 14.
"He knew it and has made the elections coincide because he thought he was interested in violence during those days and he appeared as the one with the club wrapped in the flag, but as soon as the polls have started to be at 120, we will not disturb the PSC and the independentistas in case we need their support again, "denounced the leader of the PP.
In his attack on Sanchez, Casado has come to hold him responsible for the possible altercations that the visit of the King and Princess of Asturias to Girona may cause on Saturday, November 9.
For this reason, he has urged the acting President of the Government to "put order in Catalonia at once, or we will put it in place after 10-N, because freedom and the Constitution are necessary." Casado has denounced that Sánchez is "triple responsible and cannot look the other way, because he has not wanted to do anything, because he has not left the PSC and has folded the nationalists: there are no elections that deserve this derision."
